issue.title: core-admin-linux v4.2.1 (r4.2)
issue.body:
Update of core-admin-linux to v4.2.1 for Qubes r4.2, see comments below for details and build status.

From commit: https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux/commit/fa450c643d0b8fabb152a070978de6841ed619e2

[Changes since previous version](https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux/compare/v4.2.0...v4.2.1):
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@fa450c6 version 4.2.1
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@b5f9758 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/109'
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@5e0f7c2 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/110'
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@27ae0cb qubes-vm-update: just print progress
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@d654911 qubes-vm-update: plugins
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@048549f Remove unnecessary ImageMagick build requirement
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@cb44e8a Merge branch 'xen-rc'
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@76900c2 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/106'
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@02d29b4 dom0-update: fix handling -rc xen version
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@f44d9eb Improve wording for failures of qubes-dom0-update
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@7aba186 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/105'
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@33dc00e qubes-vm-update: unify log options in dom0 and in qube
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@15fdeb1 qubes-vm-update: progress communicating over stderr instead of stdout
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@15a26c3 qubes-vm-update: check target names
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@6523761 qubes-vm-update: fixes
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@99862ed qubes-vm-update: extract ProgressReporter and Progress classes to progress_reporter.py
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@cdf36bd qubes-vm-update: refactor dnf fetch progress reporting
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@e498370 qubes-vm-update: collect output
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@f5e2083 qubes-vm-update: more logs in agent entrypoint
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@01c17a7 qubes-vm-update: ProcessResult
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@508bad8 qubes-vm-update: more efficient progress reporting
QubesOS/qubes-core-admin-linux@9f03dd5 qubes-vm-update: a parallel progress bars

Referenced issues:
QubesOS/qubes-issues#5009

If you're release manager, you can issue GPG-inline signed command:

You can choose subset of distributions like:

issue.title: Make Qubes Update tool panes resizable

labels.name: T: enhancement
labels.description: Type: enhancement. A new feature that does not yet exist or improvement of existing functionality.

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
The details pane on the Update tool is too small to see important information.
On this machine I see only 6 lines of text.(I do have many templates.)
I assume the template list is reducing the size of the "details" pane.




### The solution you'd like
Panes should resizable.
During the update process itself the template/standalone list is not so important: what is important are the Details.




### The value to a user, and who that user might be
Any user would be able to review details of update process without strain on scrolling and memory.

issue.title: R4.1 qui-devices requires gnome-icon-theme

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

R4.1, rc2



### Brief summary

Users of window managers like i3 often remove a lot of Xfce or gnome packages from dom0. On R4.0, the gui widget qui-devices was still usable. On R4.1, it requires the installation of gnome-icon-theme. This dependency should either be removed from the qui-devices code, or made explicit in the Fedora packaging. This also affects the R4.0 -> R4.1 upgrade path.


### Steps to reproduce

Remove gnome-icon-theme, run `widget-wrapper qui-devices`. You will find that the widget does nothing when clicked. In the console the traceback gives the following error:

```
gi.repository.GLib.Error: gtk-icon-theme-error-quark: Icon 'audio-input-microphone' not present in theme Adwaita (0)
```


### Expected behavior

The core Qubes widgets should not let you remove packages which inhibit their core functionality. 

Also, the upgrade path from R4.0 -> R4.1 should bring in any new dependencies for these widgets.


### Actual behavior

R4.1 systems without gnome-icon-theme cannot use the widget.

issue.title: Global Clipboard Widget: Displays wrong key combination when combination has been modified.

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1




### Brief summary

The Global Clipboard widget says "Use Ctrl + Shift + C to copy and Ctrl + Shift + V to paste" even if that is not the correct key combination. For example, under Global Settings Copy (Inter-qube) / Paste (inter-qube) I have a different key combination specified and it does not say this combination.



### Steps to reproduce

Change key combination for copy / paste and see that it does not update




### Expected behavior

It should say the correct key combination



### Actual behavior

It always list the same key combination even when a different one is configured.

issue.title: R4.1 qui-devices requires gnome-icon-theme

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

R4.1, rc2



### Brief summary

Users of window managers like i3 often remove a lot of Xfce or gnome packages from dom0. On R4.0, the gui widget qui-devices was still usable. On R4.1, it requires the installation of gnome-icon-theme. This dependency should either be removed from the qui-devices code, or made explicit in the Fedora packaging. This also affects the R4.0 -> R4.1 upgrade path.


### Steps to reproduce

Remove gnome-icon-theme, run `widget-wrapper qui-devices`. You will find that the widget does nothing when clicked. In the console the traceback gives the following error:

```
gi.repository.GLib.Error: gtk-icon-theme-error-quark: Icon 'audio-input-microphone' not present in theme Adwaita (0)
```


### Expected behavior

The core Qubes widgets should not let you remove packages which inhibit their core functionality. 

Also, the upgrade path from R4.0 -> R4.1 should bring in any new dependencies for these widgets.


### Actual behavior

R4.1 systems without gnome-icon-theme cannot use the widget.

issue.title: Global Clipboard Widget: Displays wrong key combination when combination has been modified.

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1




### Brief summary

The Global Clipboard widget says "Use Ctrl + Shift + C to copy and Ctrl + Shift + V to paste" even if that is not the correct key combination. For example, under Global Settings Copy (Inter-qube) / Paste (inter-qube) I have a different key combination specified and it does not say this combination.



### Steps to reproduce

Change key combination for copy / paste and see that it does not update




### Expected behavior

It should say the correct key combination



### Actual behavior

It always list the same key combination even when a different one is configured.

QubesOS/qubes-linux-utils@035537e Add spaces after function names
QubesOS/qubes-linux-utils@325ec5a Install and source grub.qubes-kernel-vm-support
QubesOS/qubes-linux-utils@2104b68 Ensure that /etc/default/grub is not empty
QubesOS/qubes-linux-utils@7964600 Add comments to /etc/default/grub
QubesOS/qubes-linux-utils@6a1b9c9 Fix up /etc/default/grub in postinstall script
QubesOS/qubes-linux-utils@42bfe8c Fix sed regex for mkinitcpio.conf

issue.title: tar fails to extract root.img from template.rpm

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release
4.1 with all updates applied (subscribed to testing)
### Brief summary
Qubes fails to install templates because the root.img extraction fails
### Steps to reproduce
Install template (I installed from commandline with `dnf install ./qubes-template-...`
### Expected behavior
Template is installed correctly
### Actual behavior
```archlinux: Importing data
tar: root.img: Cannot seek to 212860928: Broken pipe
tar: Exiting with failure status due to previous errors
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/bin/qvm-template-postprocess", line 5, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qubesadmin/tools/qvm_template_postprocess.py", line 431, in main
    loop.run_until_complete(post_install(args))
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.8/asyncio/base_events.py", line 616, in run_until_complete
    return future.result()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qubesadmin/tools/qvm_template_postprocess.py", line 297, in post_install
    import_root_img(vm, args.dir)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qubesadmin/tools/qvm_template_postprocess.py", line 109, in import_root_img
    raise qubesadmin.exc.QubesException('root.img extraction failed')
qubesadmin.exc.QubesException: root.img extraction failed
warning: %post(qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch) scriptlet failed, exit status 1

Error in POSTIN scriptlet in rpm package qubes-template-archlinux
  Running scriptlet: qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   2/2 
  Cleanup          : qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   2/2 
  Verifying        : qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   1/2 
  Verifying        : qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   2/2 ```
This has been tested with self-built arch template and the gentoo template I downloaded manually and moved to dom0 to install. Can't confirm it happens with "normal" installs from qvm-template too.

issue.title: `qvm-volume import` does not use `fsync`

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: major
labels.description: Priority: major. Between "default" and "critical" in severity.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

R4.1



### Brief summary


`qvm-volume import` does not use `fsync`, so there is no guarantee data has actually been committed to stable storage. 


### Steps to reproduce

Import followed by a badly-timed power failure, perhaps.

### Expected behavior

fsync() called


### Actual behavior


fsync() not called

issue.title: manager v4.1.26-1 (r4.1)
issue.body:
Update of manager to v4.1.26-1 for Qubes r4.1, see comments below for details.

Built from: https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-manager/commit/e92a307a20ceb28174f316be6b12ebb77d5eb09a

[Changes since previous version](https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-manager/compare/v4.1.25-1...v4.1.26-1):
QubesOS/qubes-manager@e92a307 version 4.1.26-1
QubesOS/qubes-manager@cca24d4 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/328'
QubesOS/qubes-manager@62b748d Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/324'
QubesOS/qubes-manager@3f1adb2 Fix sorting by icons in Qube Manager
QubesOS/qubes-manager@6ab9dba Add explanation why you can't use vm settings with AdminVMs
QubesOS/qubes-manager@942fe6a typo fix
QubesOS/qubes-manager@20b4b3c Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/327'
QubesOS/qubes-manager@c9a1568 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/326'
QubesOS/qubes-manager@eaa4586 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/325'
QubesOS/qubes-manager@b4dbb6a Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/313'
QubesOS/qubes-manager@c3c613e Make show password buttons in backup gui toggleable
QubesOS/qubes-manager@214039f Use a more intuitive tab order
QubesOS/qubes-manager@27ae47f Allow saving backup settings without passphrase
QubesOS/qubes-manager@b21566e Consistent checkbox placement
QubesOS/qubes-manager@b171a1f Make "Copy to global clipboard" selection-aware in log browser
QubesOS/qubes-manager@449d24d Fix sorting for Backup column
QubesOS/qubes-manager@2d42a48 Fix VM sorting order in Qube Manager if Sorting by State
QubesOS/qubes-manager@52b507c Fix display of kernels for Qube Settings
QubesOS/qubes-manager@a8865db Add class to VM list in Backup widget

Referenced issues:
QubesOS/qubes-issues#7776
QubesOS/qubes-issues#7073
QubesOS/qubes-issues#7715
QubesOS/qubes-issues#7366
QubesOS/qubes-issues#7853
QubesOS/qubes-issues#7633
QubesOS/qubes-issues#7897
QubesOS/qubes-issues#7066

If you're release manager, you can issue GPG-inline signed command:

* `Upload manager e92a307a20ceb28174f316be6b12ebb77d5eb09a r4.1 current repo` (available 7 days from now)
* `Upload manager e92a307a20ceb28174f316be6b12ebb77d5eb09a r4.1 current (dists) repo`, you can choose subset of distributions, like `vm-fc24 vm-fc25` (available 7 days from now)
* `Upload manager e92a307a20ceb28174f316be6b12ebb77d5eb09a r4.1 security-testing repo`

Above commands will work only if packages in current-testing repository were built from given commit (i.e. no new version superseded it).

issue.title: linux-kernel v5.15.81-1 (r4.1)
issue.body:
Update of linux-kernel to v5.15.81-1 for Qubes r4.1, see comments below for details.

Built from: https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel/commit/8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c

[Changes since previous version](https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel/compare/v5.15.78-1...v5.15.81-1):
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@8a58109 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/689' into stable-5.15
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@925ef48 Revert "Allow setting PCI_MSIX_FLAGS_MASKALL too"
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@8b81dcd Update to kernel-5.15.81

Referenced issues:


If you're release manager, you can issue GPG-inline signed command:

* `Upload linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c r4.1 current repo` (available 7 days from now)
* `Upload linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c r4.1 current (dists) repo`, you can choose subset of distributions, like `vm-fc24 vm-fc25` (available 7 days from now)
* `Upload linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c r4.1 security-testing repo`

Above commands will work only if packages in current-testing repository were built from given commit (i.e. no new version superseded it).

issue.title: linux-kernel v5.15.81-1 (r4.2)
issue.body:
Update of linux-kernel to v5.15.81-1 for Qubes r4.2, see comments below for details and build status.

From commit: https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel/commit/8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c

[Changes since previous version](https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel/compare/v5.15.78-1...v5.15.81-1):
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@8a58109 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/689' into stable-5.15
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@925ef48 Revert "Allow setting PCI_MSIX_FLAGS_MASKALL too"
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@8b81dcd Update to kernel-5.15.81

Referenced issues:


If you're release manager, you can issue GPG-inline signed command:

* `Upload-component r4.2 linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c current all` (available 5 days from now)
* `Upload-component r4.2 linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c security-testing`

You can choose subset of distributions like:
* `Upload-component r4.2 linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c current vm-bookworm,vm-fc37` (available 5 days from now)

Above commands will work only if packages in current-testing repository were built from given commit (i.e. no new version superseded it).

For more information on how to test this update, please take a look at https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/testing/#updates.

comment.body: Package for host was built ([build log](https://github.com/QubesOS/build-logs42/tree/master/build-fedora42/log_2022-12-06_03-20-02)) and uploaded to current-testing repository.

issue.title: qubes-vm-settings shows kernel pref of "" as "(none)" but once selected only as " (current)"

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

4.1rc1

### Brief summary

When a choice is applied for the "kernel" pref, it gets shown as `"choice-text (current)"`.  The available choice of `""` (empty value, for "boot the image with the kernel it provides") is labelled as `"(none)"` (which I find unclear in itself); when selected the empty value is not replaced, which ends up with the cryptic `" (current)"` string (note the leading space).

At the very least it should be `"(none) (current)"`.  Maybe the `"(none)"` string could at the same time be replaced by something more useful, e.g. `"(vm image)"`

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
Calling `qubes-vm-settings dom0` from `dom0` provides some strange exception dialog about critical error instead of message describing the fact that `qubes-vm-settings` does not support of showing any of `dom0` properties or settings.

> Whoops. A critical error has **occured**. This is **most likely a bug in Qubes Manager**.
> 
> QubesNoSuchPropertyError: Invalid property 'netvm' of dom0
> at line 11
> of file /usr/bin/qubes-vm-settings.

### The solution you'd like
Some user-friendly message with a proper text about calling `qubes-vm-settings` of `dom0` not being allowed.
Because logically it could have worked.
Maybe the message should be outputed to the terminal (stderr) if application is called from terminal.

### The value to a user, and who that user might be
User-friendly reaction to such situation.

### More
Maybe there is a typo in this message: `occured` (should be `occurred`).

issue.title: Qube Manager: Sorting by the "backup" column doesn't actually sort by backup-enabled status

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: needs diagnosis
labels.description: Requires technical diagnosis from developer. Replace with "diagnosed" or remove if otherwise closed.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

Qubes 4.1.1



### Brief summary

In the Qube Manager, clicking on the "backup" column (the one with the check boxes) seems like it's trying to sort the rows by that column, but the rows are not actually sorted by backup status.



### Steps to reproduce

Click on the "backup" column heading.



### Expected behavior

Rows are sorted by whether their "backup" box is checked or not, e.g., all checked boxes grouped together.



### Actual behavior

The sorting changes, but seemingly randomly. The checked boxes are not grouped together.

issue.title: Qubes Backup + Restore GUI tools: "Reveal passphrase" button works only while held down instead of toggling on and off

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

labels.name: accessibility
labels.description: This issue concerns the use of Qubes OS by persons with disabilities.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

Qubes 4.1.1



### Brief summary

In the Qubes Backup and Restore GUI tools, the "eye" or "eye with a line through it" buttons, which control whether the passphrase is masked or legible, must be held down in order to reveal the passphrase. The normal behavior for such buttons is to toggle on and off.



### Steps to reproduce

Try to enter a passphrase in the Qubes Backup and Restore GUI tools while being able to read the characters you're typing.



### Expected behavior

You can press the "reveal passphrase" button, then you'll be able to enter unmasked characters.



### Actual behavior

You can't see the unmasked characters unless you're holding down the "reveal passphrase" button, but holding down the button also prevents any characters from being entered, so it's impossible to see what you're typing as you're typing it. (Also, even if it were possible to enter characters while holding down the button, typing while holding down a mouse button is really hard. :P)

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1 updated from testing repositories

### Brief summary
The Icon column appears to be sortable but only sorts by color.

### Steps to reproduce
Click on top of icon column

### Expected behavior
If the icons mean anything, (and it's opaque what the intended meaning is), then the rows should be sorted by that meaning.
Possibly the rows should be sorted by color and subsorted by meaning.


### Actual behavior
Rows are sorted only by color.

issue.title: R4.1 Qubes Manager sort by State fails to group dom0 with other running VMs

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: needs diagnosis
labels.description: Requires technical diagnosis from developer. Replace with "diagnosed" or remove if otherwise closed.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
R4.1rc1 fully updated

### Brief summary
R4.1 Qubes Manager sort by State fails to group dom0 with other running VMs

### Steps to reproduce
1. Start at least one domU VM.
2. Open Qubes Manager.
3. Click on State column.
4. Note that running VMs (shown with green dot) are grouped at the beginning of the list, but dom0 (also shown with green dot) is at the end of the list, while all non-running VMs are shown in between.

### Expected behavior
dom0 would be grouped with running VMs.

### Actual behavior
Schrödinger's dom0 off by itself in third section of the list.

Note that this bug is rather minor...but could lead to some problems. E.g. if you had planned to take some action that required all domU VMs to be halted but had mistakenly reverse sorted the list, you will see only dom0 "running" at the top. If your list of VMs is long enough, you might assume no other VMs are running, when in fact the running VMs are now at the bottom of the list off-screen.

B

issue.title: QubesManager/Logs: Make "Copy to global clipboard" selection-aware

labels.name: T: enhancement
labels.description: Type: enhancement. A new feature that does not yet exist or improvement of existing functionality.

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

milestone.title: Release TBD
milestone.description: Enhancements or tasks that will be specific to a Qubes OS release but have yet to be assigned to a specific release milestone. Bugs should never be assigned to this milestone, because every bug is a problem or defect in something that already exists.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
When viewing a VMs console log via Qubes Manger in 4.1.1, I can mark a part of the log and press "Copy top global clipboard".
Against expectation the *whole* log is copied to the global clipboard.




### The solution you'd like
If there is no selection, the whole log can be copied; otherwise only the selection should be copied.
Or at least: Thje user should be asked what to copy when a selection is present.

### The value to a user, and who that user might be
Reduce the amount of data copied to the clipboard, make the match user's expectations.

issue.title: Make Qubes Update tool panes resizable

labels.name: T: enhancement
labels.description: Type: enhancement. A new feature that does not yet exist or improvement of existing functionality.

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
The details pane on the Update tool is too small to see important information.
On this machine I see only 6 lines of text.(I do have many templates.)
I assume the template list is reducing the size of the "details" pane.




### The solution you'd like
Panes should resizable.
During the update process itself the template/standalone list is not so important: what is important are the Details.




### The value to a user, and who that user might be
Any user would be able to review details of update process without strain on scrolling and memory.

issue.title: R4.1 qui-devices requires gnome-icon-theme

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

R4.1, rc2



### Brief summary

Users of window managers like i3 often remove a lot of Xfce or gnome packages from dom0. On R4.0, the gui widget qui-devices was still usable. On R4.1, it requires the installation of gnome-icon-theme. This dependency should either be removed from the qui-devices code, or made explicit in the Fedora packaging. This also affects the R4.0 -> R4.1 upgrade path.


### Steps to reproduce

Remove gnome-icon-theme, run `widget-wrapper qui-devices`. You will find that the widget does nothing when clicked. In the console the traceback gives the following error:

```
gi.repository.GLib.Error: gtk-icon-theme-error-quark: Icon 'audio-input-microphone' not present in theme Adwaita (0)
```


### Expected behavior

The core Qubes widgets should not let you remove packages which inhibit their core functionality. 

Also, the upgrade path from R4.0 -> R4.1 should bring in any new dependencies for these widgets.


### Actual behavior

R4.1 systems without gnome-icon-theme cannot use the widget.

issue.title: Global Clipboard Widget: Displays wrong key combination when combination has been modified.

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1




### Brief summary

The Global Clipboard widget says "Use Ctrl + Shift + C to copy and Ctrl + Shift + V to paste" even if that is not the correct key combination. For example, under Global Settings Copy (Inter-qube) / Paste (inter-qube) I have a different key combination specified and it does not say this combination.



### Steps to reproduce

Change key combination for copy / paste and see that it does not update




### Expected behavior

It should say the correct key combination



### Actual behavior

It always list the same key combination even when a different one is configured.

issue.title: Make Qubes Update tool panes resizable

labels.name: T: enhancement
labels.description: Type: enhancement. A new feature that does not yet exist or improvement of existing functionality.

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
The details pane on the Update tool is too small to see important information.
On this machine I see only 6 lines of text.(I do have many templates.)
I assume the template list is reducing the size of the "details" pane.




### The solution you'd like
Panes should resizable.
During the update process itself the template/standalone list is not so important: what is important are the Details.




### The value to a user, and who that user might be
Any user would be able to review details of update process without strain on scrolling and memory.

issue.title: R4.1 qui-devices requires gnome-icon-theme

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

R4.1, rc2



### Brief summary

Users of window managers like i3 often remove a lot of Xfce or gnome packages from dom0. On R4.0, the gui widget qui-devices was still usable. On R4.1, it requires the installation of gnome-icon-theme. This dependency should either be removed from the qui-devices code, or made explicit in the Fedora packaging. This also affects the R4.0 -> R4.1 upgrade path.


### Steps to reproduce

Remove gnome-icon-theme, run `widget-wrapper qui-devices`. You will find that the widget does nothing when clicked. In the console the traceback gives the following error:

```
gi.repository.GLib.Error: gtk-icon-theme-error-quark: Icon 'audio-input-microphone' not present in theme Adwaita (0)
```


### Expected behavior

The core Qubes widgets should not let you remove packages which inhibit their core functionality. 

Also, the upgrade path from R4.0 -> R4.1 should bring in any new dependencies for these widgets.


### Actual behavior

R4.1 systems without gnome-icon-theme cannot use the widget.

issue.title: Global Clipboard Widget: Displays wrong key combination when combination has been modified.

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1




### Brief summary

The Global Clipboard widget says "Use Ctrl + Shift + C to copy and Ctrl + Shift + V to paste" even if that is not the correct key combination. For example, under Global Settings Copy (Inter-qube) / Paste (inter-qube) I have a different key combination specified and it does not say this combination.



### Steps to reproduce

Change key combination for copy / paste and see that it does not update




### Expected behavior

It should say the correct key combination



### Actual behavior

It always list the same key combination even when a different one is configured.

issue.title: tar fails to extract root.img from template.rpm

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release
4.1 with all updates applied (subscribed to testing)
### Brief summary
Qubes fails to install templates because the root.img extraction fails
### Steps to reproduce
Install template (I installed from commandline with `dnf install ./qubes-template-...`
### Expected behavior
Template is installed correctly
### Actual behavior
```archlinux: Importing data
tar: root.img: Cannot seek to 212860928: Broken pipe
tar: Exiting with failure status due to previous errors
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/bin/qvm-template-postprocess", line 5, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qubesadmin/tools/qvm_template_postprocess.py", line 431, in main
    loop.run_until_complete(post_install(args))
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.8/asyncio/base_events.py", line 616, in run_until_complete
    return future.result()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qubesadmin/tools/qvm_template_postprocess.py", line 297, in post_install
    import_root_img(vm, args.dir)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qubesadmin/tools/qvm_template_postprocess.py", line 109, in import_root_img
    raise qubesadmin.exc.QubesException('root.img extraction failed')
qubesadmin.exc.QubesException: root.img extraction failed
warning: %post(qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch) scriptlet failed, exit status 1

Error in POSTIN scriptlet in rpm package qubes-template-archlinux
  Running scriptlet: qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   2/2 
  Cleanup          : qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   2/2 
  Verifying        : qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   1/2 
  Verifying        : qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   2/2 ```
This has been tested with self-built arch template and the gentoo template I downloaded manually and moved to dom0 to install. Can't confirm it happens with "normal" installs from qvm-template too.

issue.title: `qvm-volume import` does not use `fsync`

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: major
labels.description: Priority: major. Between "default" and "critical" in severity.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

R4.1



### Brief summary


`qvm-volume import` does not use `fsync`, so there is no guarantee data has actually been committed to stable storage. 


### Steps to reproduce

Import followed by a badly-timed power failure, perhaps.

### Expected behavior

fsync() called


### Actual behavior


fsync() not called

issue.title: linux-kernel v5.15.81-1 (r4.1)
issue.body:
Update of linux-kernel to v5.15.81-1 for Qubes r4.1, see comments below for details.

Built from: https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel/commit/8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c

[Changes since previous version](https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel/compare/v5.15.78-1...v5.15.81-1):
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@8a58109 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/689' into stable-5.15
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@925ef48 Revert "Allow setting PCI_MSIX_FLAGS_MASKALL too"
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@8b81dcd Update to kernel-5.15.81

Referenced issues:


If you're release manager, you can issue GPG-inline signed command:

* `Upload linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c r4.1 current repo` (available 7 days from now)
* `Upload linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c r4.1 current (dists) repo`, you can choose subset of distributions, like `vm-fc24 vm-fc25` (available 7 days from now)
* `Upload linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c r4.1 security-testing repo`

Above commands will work only if packages in current-testing repository were built from given commit (i.e. no new version superseded it).

issue.title: qubes-vm-settings shows kernel pref of "" as "(none)" but once selected only as " (current)"

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

4.1rc1

### Brief summary

When a choice is applied for the "kernel" pref, it gets shown as `"choice-text (current)"`.  The available choice of `""` (empty value, for "boot the image with the kernel it provides") is labelled as `"(none)"` (which I find unclear in itself); when selected the empty value is not replaced, which ends up with the cryptic `" (current)"` string (note the leading space).

At the very least it should be `"(none) (current)"`.  Maybe the `"(none)"` string could at the same time be replaced by something more useful, e.g. `"(vm image)"`

issue.title: Provide a user-friendly message in case `qubes-vm-settings` is called for `dom0` (add some checks)

labels.name: T: enhancement
labels.description: Type: enhancement. A new feature that does not yet exist or improvement of existing functionality.

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

milestone.title: Release TBD
milestone.description: Enhancements or tasks that will be specific to a Qubes OS release but have yet to be assigned to a specific release milestone. Bugs should never be assigned to this milestone, because every bug is a problem or defect in something that already exists.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
Calling `qubes-vm-settings dom0` from `dom0` provides some strange exception dialog about critical error instead of message describing the fact that `qubes-vm-settings` does not support of showing any of `dom0` properties or settings.

> Whoops. A critical error has **occured**. This is **most likely a bug in Qubes Manager**.
> 
> QubesNoSuchPropertyError: Invalid property 'netvm' of dom0
> at line 11
> of file /usr/bin/qubes-vm-settings.

### The solution you'd like
Some user-friendly message with a proper text about calling `qubes-vm-settings` of `dom0` not being allowed.
Because logically it could have worked.
Maybe the message should be outputed to the terminal (stderr) if application is called from terminal.

### The value to a user, and who that user might be
User-friendly reaction to such situation.

### More
Maybe there is a typo in this message: `occured` (should be `occurred`).

issue.title: Qube Manager: Sorting by the "backup" column doesn't actually sort by backup-enabled status

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: needs diagnosis
labels.description: Requires technical diagnosis from developer. Replace with "diagnosed" or remove if otherwise closed.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

Qubes 4.1.1



### Brief summary

In the Qube Manager, clicking on the "backup" column (the one with the check boxes) seems like it's trying to sort the rows by that column, but the rows are not actually sorted by backup status.



### Steps to reproduce

Click on the "backup" column heading.



### Expected behavior

Rows are sorted by whether their "backup" box is checked or not, e.g., all checked boxes grouped together.



### Actual behavior

The sorting changes, but seemingly randomly. The checked boxes are not grouped together.

issue.title: Qubes Backup + Restore GUI tools: "Reveal passphrase" button works only while held down instead of toggling on and off

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

labels.name: accessibility
labels.description: This issue concerns the use of Qubes OS by persons with disabilities.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

Qubes 4.1.1



### Brief summary

In the Qubes Backup and Restore GUI tools, the "eye" or "eye with a line through it" buttons, which control whether the passphrase is masked or legible, must be held down in order to reveal the passphrase. The normal behavior for such buttons is to toggle on and off.



### Steps to reproduce

Try to enter a passphrase in the Qubes Backup and Restore GUI tools while being able to read the characters you're typing.



### Expected behavior

You can press the "reveal passphrase" button, then you'll be able to enter unmasked characters.



### Actual behavior

You can't see the unmasked characters unless you're holding down the "reveal passphrase" button, but holding down the button also prevents any characters from being entered, so it's impossible to see what you're typing as you're typing it. (Also, even if it were possible to enter characters while holding down the button, typing while holding down a mouse button is really hard. :P)

issue.body:
### The problem you're addressing (if any)

Backup menu not showing type name of the VM is it a template or appvm or..etc, when you have many VMs its not easy to recognize them by memory and going back to check what are they not pleasant choice.


### The solution you'd like

Add VM/Qube type beside VM/Qube name

### The value to a user, and who that user might be


Ease/Surety to know what hes backing up, Because if user doesnt want to backup any TemplateVM or Standalone but only AppVMs thats impossible he know that unless he memorize them from Qube Manager menu/list.


### Image

E.g: Fedora-35 is it standalone or template or appvm or HVM..? (Its StandaloneVM, But Fedora-34 is a TemplateVM = Looks exactly the same)

![Improvetemplatenames](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11895339/159372710-f267c3f4-dff6-46bb-9d19-8074b0a0b000.png)

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1 updated from testing repositories

### Brief summary
The Icon column appears to be sortable but only sorts by color.

### Steps to reproduce
Click on top of icon column

### Expected behavior
If the icons mean anything, (and it's opaque what the intended meaning is), then the rows should be sorted by that meaning.
Possibly the rows should be sorted by color and subsorted by meaning.


### Actual behavior
Rows are sorted only by color.

issue.title: R4.1 Qubes Manager sort by State fails to group dom0 with other running VMs

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: needs diagnosis
labels.description: Requires technical diagnosis from developer. Replace with "diagnosed" or remove if otherwise closed.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
R4.1rc1 fully updated

### Brief summary
R4.1 Qubes Manager sort by State fails to group dom0 with other running VMs

### Steps to reproduce
1. Start at least one domU VM.
2. Open Qubes Manager.
3. Click on State column.
4. Note that running VMs (shown with green dot) are grouped at the beginning of the list, but dom0 (also shown with green dot) is at the end of the list, while all non-running VMs are shown in between.

### Expected behavior
dom0 would be grouped with running VMs.

### Actual behavior
Schrödinger's dom0 off by itself in third section of the list.

Note that this bug is rather minor...but could lead to some problems. E.g. if you had planned to take some action that required all domU VMs to be halted but had mistakenly reverse sorted the list, you will see only dom0 "running" at the top. If your list of VMs is long enough, you might assume no other VMs are running, when in fact the running VMs are now at the bottom of the list off-screen.

B

milestone.description: Enhancements or tasks that will be specific to a Qubes OS release but have yet to be assigned to a specific release milestone. Bugs should never be assigned to this milestone, because every bug is a problem or defect in something that already exists.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
When viewing a VMs console log via Qubes Manger in 4.1.1, I can mark a part of the log and press "Copy top global clipboard".
Against expectation the *whole* log is copied to the global clipboard.




### The solution you'd like
If there is no selection, the whole log can be copied; otherwise only the selection should be copied.
Or at least: Thje user should be asked what to copy when a selection is present.

### The value to a user, and who that user might be
Reduce the amount of data copied to the clipboard, make the match user's expectations.

issue.title: Make Qubes Update tool panes resizable

labels.name: T: enhancement
labels.description: Type: enhancement. A new feature that does not yet exist or improvement of existing functionality.

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
The details pane on the Update tool is too small to see important information.
On this machine I see only 6 lines of text.(I do have many templates.)
I assume the template list is reducing the size of the "details" pane.




### The solution you'd like
Panes should resizable.
During the update process itself the template/standalone list is not so important: what is important are the Details.




### The value to a user, and who that user might be
Any user would be able to review details of update process without strain on scrolling and memory.

issue.title: R4.1 qui-devices requires gnome-icon-theme

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

R4.1, rc2



### Brief summary

Users of window managers like i3 often remove a lot of Xfce or gnome packages from dom0. On R4.0, the gui widget qui-devices was still usable. On R4.1, it requires the installation of gnome-icon-theme. This dependency should either be removed from the qui-devices code, or made explicit in the Fedora packaging. This also affects the R4.0 -> R4.1 upgrade path.


### Steps to reproduce

Remove gnome-icon-theme, run `widget-wrapper qui-devices`. You will find that the widget does nothing when clicked. In the console the traceback gives the following error:

```
gi.repository.GLib.Error: gtk-icon-theme-error-quark: Icon 'audio-input-microphone' not present in theme Adwaita (0)
```


### Expected behavior

The core Qubes widgets should not let you remove packages which inhibit their core functionality. 

Also, the upgrade path from R4.0 -> R4.1 should bring in any new dependencies for these widgets.


### Actual behavior

R4.1 systems without gnome-icon-theme cannot use the widget.

issue.title: Global Clipboard Widget: Displays wrong key combination when combination has been modified.

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1




### Brief summary

The Global Clipboard widget says "Use Ctrl + Shift + C to copy and Ctrl + Shift + V to paste" even if that is not the correct key combination. For example, under Global Settings Copy (Inter-qube) / Paste (inter-qube) I have a different key combination specified and it does not say this combination.



### Steps to reproduce

Change key combination for copy / paste and see that it does not update




### Expected behavior

It should say the correct key combination



### Actual behavior

It always list the same key combination even when a different one is configured.

issue.title: R4.1 qui-devices requires gnome-icon-theme

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

R4.1, rc2



### Brief summary

Users of window managers like i3 often remove a lot of Xfce or gnome packages from dom0. On R4.0, the gui widget qui-devices was still usable. On R4.1, it requires the installation of gnome-icon-theme. This dependency should either be removed from the qui-devices code, or made explicit in the Fedora packaging. This also affects the R4.0 -> R4.1 upgrade path.


### Steps to reproduce

Remove gnome-icon-theme, run `widget-wrapper qui-devices`. You will find that the widget does nothing when clicked. In the console the traceback gives the following error:

```
gi.repository.GLib.Error: gtk-icon-theme-error-quark: Icon 'audio-input-microphone' not present in theme Adwaita (0)
```


### Expected behavior

The core Qubes widgets should not let you remove packages which inhibit their core functionality. 

Also, the upgrade path from R4.0 -> R4.1 should bring in any new dependencies for these widgets.


### Actual behavior

R4.1 systems without gnome-icon-theme cannot use the widget.

issue.title: Global Clipboard Widget: Displays wrong key combination when combination has been modified.

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
4.1




### Brief summary

The Global Clipboard widget says "Use Ctrl + Shift + C to copy and Ctrl + Shift + V to paste" even if that is not the correct key combination. For example, under Global Settings Copy (Inter-qube) / Paste (inter-qube) I have a different key combination specified and it does not say this combination.



### Steps to reproduce

Change key combination for copy / paste and see that it does not update




### Expected behavior

It should say the correct key combination



### Actual behavior

It always list the same key combination even when a different one is configured.

issue.title: tar fails to extract root.img from template.rpm

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release
4.1 with all updates applied (subscribed to testing)
### Brief summary
Qubes fails to install templates because the root.img extraction fails
### Steps to reproduce
Install template (I installed from commandline with `dnf install ./qubes-template-...`
### Expected behavior
Template is installed correctly
### Actual behavior
```archlinux: Importing data
tar: root.img: Cannot seek to 212860928: Broken pipe
tar: Exiting with failure status due to previous errors
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/bin/qvm-template-postprocess", line 5, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qubesadmin/tools/qvm_template_postprocess.py", line 431, in main
    loop.run_until_complete(post_install(args))
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.8/asyncio/base_events.py", line 616, in run_until_complete
    return future.result()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qubesadmin/tools/qvm_template_postprocess.py", line 297, in post_install
    import_root_img(vm, args.dir)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/site-packages/qubesadmin/tools/qvm_template_postprocess.py", line 109, in import_root_img
    raise qubesadmin.exc.QubesException('root.img extraction failed')
qubesadmin.exc.QubesException: root.img extraction failed
warning: %post(qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch) scriptlet failed, exit status 1

Error in POSTIN scriptlet in rpm package qubes-template-archlinux
  Running scriptlet: qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   2/2 
  Cleanup          : qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   2/2 
  Verifying        : qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   1/2 
  Verifying        : qubes-template-archlinux-4.0.6-202201062107.noarch                   2/2 ```
This has been tested with self-built arch template and the gentoo template I downloaded manually and moved to dom0 to install. Can't confirm it happens with "normal" installs from qvm-template too.

issue.title: `qvm-volume import` does not use `fsync`

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: major
labels.description: Priority: major. Between "default" and "critical" in severity.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

R4.1



### Brief summary


`qvm-volume import` does not use `fsync`, so there is no guarantee data has actually been committed to stable storage. 


### Steps to reproduce

Import followed by a badly-timed power failure, perhaps.

### Expected behavior

fsync() called


### Actual behavior


fsync() not called

issue.title: linux-kernel v5.15.81-1 (r4.1)
issue.body:
Update of linux-kernel to v5.15.81-1 for Qubes r4.1, see comments below for details.

Built from: https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel/commit/8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c

[Changes since previous version](https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel/compare/v5.15.78-1...v5.15.81-1):
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@8a58109 Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/pr/689' into stable-5.15
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@925ef48 Revert "Allow setting PCI_MSIX_FLAGS_MASKALL too"
QubesOS/qubes-linux-kernel@8b81dcd Update to kernel-5.15.81

Referenced issues:


If you're release manager, you can issue GPG-inline signed command:

* `Upload linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c r4.1 current repo` (available 7 days from now)
* `Upload linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c r4.1 current (dists) repo`, you can choose subset of distributions, like `vm-fc24 vm-fc25` (available 7 days from now)
* `Upload linux-kernel 8a581090355c7e4b4d55035668462fdd8a68af0c r4.1 security-testing repo`

Above commands will work only if packages in current-testing repository were built from given commit (i.e. no new version superseded it).

issue.title: qubes-vm-settings shows kernel pref of "" as "(none)" but once selected only as " (current)"

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: default
labels.description: Priority: default. Default priority for new issues, to be replaced given sufficient information.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
### Qubes OS release

4.1rc1

### Brief summary

When a choice is applied for the "kernel" pref, it gets shown as `"choice-text (current)"`.  The available choice of `""` (empty value, for "boot the image with the kernel it provides") is labelled as `"(none)"` (which I find unclear in itself); when selected the empty value is not replaced, which ends up with the cryptic `" (current)"` string (note the leading space).

At the very least it should be `"(none) (current)"`.  Maybe the `"(none)"` string could at the same time be replaced by something more useful, e.g. `"(vm image)"`

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
Calling `qubes-vm-settings dom0` from `dom0` provides some strange exception dialog about critical error instead of message describing the fact that `qubes-vm-settings` does not support of showing any of `dom0` properties or settings.

> Whoops. A critical error has **occured**. This is **most likely a bug in Qubes Manager**.
> 
> QubesNoSuchPropertyError: Invalid property 'netvm' of dom0
> at line 11
> of file /usr/bin/qubes-vm-settings.

### The solution you'd like
Some user-friendly message with a proper text about calling `qubes-vm-settings` of `dom0` not being allowed.
Because logically it could have worked.
Maybe the message should be outputed to the terminal (stderr) if application is called from terminal.

### The value to a user, and who that user might be
User-friendly reaction to such situation.

### More
Maybe there is a typo in this message: `occured` (should be `occurred`).

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: needs diagnosis
labels.description: Requires technical diagnosis from developer. Replace with "diagnosed" or remove if otherwise closed.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

Qubes 4.1.1



### Brief summary

In the Qube Manager, clicking on the "backup" column (the one with the check boxes) seems like it's trying to sort the rows by that column, but the rows are not actually sorted by backup status.



### Steps to reproduce

Click on the "backup" column heading.



### Expected behavior

Rows are sorted by whether their "backup" box is checked or not, e.g., all checked boxes grouped together.



### Actual behavior

The sorting changes, but seemingly randomly. The checked boxes are not grouped together.

issue.title: Qubes Backup + Restore GUI tools: "Reveal passphrase" button works only while held down instead of toggling on and off

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience

labels.name: accessibility
labels.description: This issue concerns the use of Qubes OS by persons with disabilities.

labels.name: diagnosed
labels.description: Technical diagnosis has been performed (see issue comments).

labels.name: pr submitted
labels.description: A pull request has been submitted for this issue.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release

Qubes 4.1.1



### Brief summary

In the Qubes Backup and Restore GUI tools, the "eye" or "eye with a line through it" buttons, which control whether the passphrase is masked or legible, must be held down in order to reveal the passphrase. The normal behavior for such buttons is to toggle on and off.



### Steps to reproduce

Try to enter a passphrase in the Qubes Backup and Restore GUI tools while being able to read the characters you're typing.



### Expected behavior

You can press the "reveal passphrase" button, then you'll be able to enter unmasked characters.



### Actual behavior

You can't see the unmasked characters unless you're holding down the "reveal passphrase" button, but holding down the button also prevents any characters from being entered, so it's impossible to see what you're typing as you're typing it. (Also, even if it were possible to enter characters while holding down the button, typing while holding down a mouse button is really hard. :P)

issue.title: R4.1 Qubes Manager sort by State fails to group dom0 with other running VMs

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Type: bug report. A problem or defect resulting in unintended behavior in something that exists.

labels.name: P: minor
labels.description: Priority: minor. The lowest priority, below "default."

labels.name: needs diagnosis
labels.description: Requires technical diagnosis from developer. Replace with "diagnosed" or remove if otherwise closed.

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### Qubes OS release
R4.1rc1 fully updated

### Brief summary
R4.1 Qubes Manager sort by State fails to group dom0 with other running VMs

### Steps to reproduce
1. Start at least one domU VM.
2. Open Qubes Manager.
3. Click on State column.
4. Note that running VMs (shown with green dot) are grouped at the beginning of the list, but dom0 (also shown with green dot) is at the end of the list, while all non-running VMs are shown in between.

### Expected behavior
dom0 would be grouped with running VMs.

### Actual behavior
Schrödinger's dom0 off by itself in third section of the list.

Note that this bug is rather minor...but could lead to some problems. E.g. if you had planned to take some action that required all domU VMs to be halted but had mistakenly reverse sorted the list, you will see only dom0 "running" at the top. If your list of VMs is long enough, you might assume no other VMs are running, when in fact the running VMs are now at the bottom of the list off-screen.

B

issue.body:
[How to file a helpful issue](https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/issue-tracking/)

### The problem you're addressing (if any)
When viewing a VMs console log via Qubes Manger in 4.1.1, I can mark a part of the log and press "Copy top global clipboard".
Against expectation the *whole* log is copied to the global clipboard.




### The solution you'd like
If there is no selection, the whole log can be copied; otherwise only the selection should be copied.
Or at least: Thje user should be asked what to copy when a selection is present.

### The value to a user, and who that user might be
Reduce the amount of data copied to the clipboard, make the match user's expectations.
